ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Please tell me your full name.
Notes: 1 point for first name; 1 point for last name

ElementDescription: What is todays date? What day of the week is it? What season of the year is it?
Notes: 1 point for month; 1 point for date; 1 point for year; 1 point for day of week; 1 point for season

ElementDescription: Please tell me your age. Please tell me your phone number.
Notes: 1 point for age; 1 point for phone number

ElementDescription: Count backwards from 20 to 1.
Notes: 2 points if completely correct on first trial; 1 point if completely correct on second trial; 0 points if incorrect on second trial

ElementDescription: I am going to read you a list of ten words. Please listen carefully and try to remember them. When I am done, tell me as many words as you can, in any order. Ready? The words are: cabin, pipe, elephant, chest, silk, theatre, watch, whip, pillow, giant. Now tell me all the words you can remember.
Notes: 1 point for each correct response. No penalty for repetitions or intrusions.

ElementDescription: One hundred minus 7 equals what? And 7 from that? Keep going. Keep going. Keep going.
Notes: Stop at 5 serial subtractions. 1 point for each correct subtraction. (93-86-79-72-65) Do not inform the participant of incorrect responses but allow subtractions to be made from their last response (e.g., 93-85-78-71-65 would get 3 points).

ElementDescription: What do people usually use to cut paper? How many things are in a dozen? What do you call the prickly green plant that lives in the desert? What animal does wool come from?
Notes: 1 point for scissor or shears; 1 point for 12; 1 point for cactus; 1 point sheep or lamb

ElementDescription: Say this: No ifs, ands, or buts. Say this: Methodist Episcopal.
Notes: 1 point for complete repetition on the first trial. Repeat only if poorly presented.

ElementDescription: What is the full name of the President of the United States right now? What is the full name of the Vice President?
Notes: 1 point for correct first name (Donald); 1 point for correct last name (Trump); 1 point for correct first name (Mike); 1 point for correct first name (Pence)

ElementDescription: With your finger, tap 5 times on the part of the phone you speak into.
Notes: 2 points if 5 taps are heard; 1 point if participant taps more or less than 5 times

ElementDescription: I am going to give you a word and I want you to give me its opposite. For example, the opposite of hot is cold. What is the opposite of west? What is the opposite of generous?
Notes: 1 point for east.; 1 point for selfish, greedy, stingy, tight, cheap, mean, meager, skimpy, or other good antonyms.

ElementDescription: Please tell me all the words you remember from the list I gave you before.
Notes: 1 point for each correct response. No penalty for repetitions or intrusions. (cabin, pipe, elephant, chest, silk, theatre, watch, whip, pillow, giant)

ElementDescription: Telephone Interview for Cognitive Status - Total Score
What is your home address?
Notes: 1 point for house number; 1 point for street name; 1 point for city; 1 point for day of state; 1 point for zip

ElementDescription: Who is the President of the United States right now?
Notes: 1 point for correct first and last name only

ElementDescription: Who is the Vice President of the United States right now?
Notes: 1 point for correct first and last name only

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
